Differential Equations.name: General Form of a Differential Equation
Differential Equations.description: Represents the general form of a differential equation relating a function to its derivatives.

example.problem: \text{Identify the general form of the differential equation } y'' + 3y' + 2y = 0.

Differential Equations.name: Order of a Differential Equation
Differential Equations.formula: \text{Order} = n \text{ where } y^{(n)} \text{ is the highest derivative}
Differential Equations.description: The order is the highest derivative appearing in the equation.

Differential Equations.name: Degree of a Differential Equation
Differential Equations.formula: \text{Degree} = m \text{ where the highest derivative is raised to power } m
Differential Equations.description: The degree is the power of the highest-order derivative when the equation is polynomial in derivatives.

Differential Equations.name: Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE)
Differential Equations.formula: F(x, y, y', \dots, y^{(n)}) = 0

variables.F: Function of single independent variable x and its derivatives

Differential Equations.description: An ODE involves functions of one independent variable and its derivatives.

example.problem: \text{Classify } y' + P(x)y = Q(x) \text{ as ODE or PDE.}

Differential Equations.name: Partial Differential Equation (PDE)
Differential Equations.formula: F(x_1, \dots, x_n, \frac{\partial y}{\partial x_i}, \dots) = 0

variables.F: Function of multiple independent variables and partial derivatives

Differential Equations.description: A PDE involves partial derivatives with respect to multiple independent variables.

example.problem: \text{Classify } \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} + \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial y^2} = 0 \text{ as ODE or PDE.}

Differential Equations.name: Linear Differential Equation
Differential Equations.formula: a_n y^{(n)} + \dots + a_1 y' + a_0 y = g(x)
Differential Equations.description: Linear if the dependent variable and its derivatives appear to the first power and not multiplied together.

Differential Equations.name: Non-Linear Differential Equation
Differential Equations.formula: F(y, y', \dots) \text{ contains products or powers >1 of y or derivatives}
Differential Equations.description: Non-linear if y or derivatives are raised to powers greater than 1 or multiplied together.

Differential Equations.name: Form DE by Eliminating Arbitrary Constants
Differential Equations.formula: \text{Differentiate and eliminate constants from } y = f(x, c_1, \dots, c_n)
Differential Equations.description: Differentiate the equation enough times and solve to eliminate constants, yielding a DE of order n for n constants.

example.problem: \text{Form the DE by eliminating the constant } c \text{ from } y = c \sin x.

Differential Equations.name: Initial Value Problem (IVP)
Differential Equations.description: A DE with initial conditions to find a unique solution satisfying the conditions at a starting point.

Differential Equations.name: Boundary Value Problem (BVP)
Differential Equations.formula: y'' + p(x)y' + q(x)y = r(x), \ y(a) = \alpha, \ y(b) = \beta

variables.\\alpha, \\beta: Boundary conditions at x = a and x = b

Differential Equations.description: A DE with conditions specified at two different points (boundaries), common in physical problems like heat conduction.

example.problem: \text{Solve the BVP } y'' + y = 0, \ y(0) = 0, \ y(\pi) = 0.

Differential Equations.name: Particular Solution with Initial Conditions
Differential Equations.formula: y_p = y_g + c \text{ adjusted to satisfy ICs}
Differential Equations.description: Apply initial or boundary conditions to the general solution to find the particular solution.

example.problem: \text{Find the particular solution to } y' - 2y = 0 \text{ with } y(0) = 3.

Differential Equations.name: First-Order Separable DE
Differential Equations.formula: \frac{dy}{dx} = f(x) g(y) \implies \int \frac{dy}{g(y)} = \int f(x) \, dx
Differential Equations.description: Separate variables and integrate both sides to solve.

Differential Equations.name: Homogeneous Function Test
Differential Equations.formula: f(tx, ty) = t^k f(x, y) \text{ (homogeneous of degree k)}
Differential Equations.description: A function is homogeneous if scaling arguments by t scales the function by t^k.

Differential Equations.name: Exact Differential Equation
Differential Equations.formula: M(x,y) dx + N(x,y) dy = 0 \text{ where } \frac{\partial M}{\partial y} = \frac{\partial N}{\partial x}
Differential Equations.description: An equation is exact if it is the total differential of some function; solve by integrating M dx and adding integral of (N - ∂/∂y ∫M dx) dy.

example.problem: \text{Is } (2xy + y) dx + (x^2 + x) dy = 0 \text{ exact? Solve it.}

Differential Equations.name: Integrating Factor for Non-Exact DE
Differential Equations.formula: \mu = e^{\int \frac{1}{N} \left( \frac{\partial M}{\partial y} - \frac{\partial N}{\partial x} \right) dy} \text{ (if function of y only)}
Differential Equations.description: Multiply by an integrating factor to make the equation exact; check if (∂M/∂y - ∂N/∂x)/N is function of y only.

example.problem: \text{Find integrating factor for } y dx + (x + y^2) dy = 0.

Differential Equations.name: First-Order Linear DE
Differential Equations.formula: y' + P(x) y = Q(x), \ \mu = e^{\int P dx}, \ y \mu = \int \mu Q \, dx + c
Differential Equations.description: Standard form; multiply by integrating factor to make left side exact.

Differential Equations.name: Second-Order Linear Homogeneous DE
Differential Equations.formula: y'' + p y' + q y = 0
Differential Equations.description: Homogeneous if right side is 0; solutions from characteristic equation for constant coefficients.

Differential Equations.name: Method of Reduction of Order
Differential Equations.formula: Assume\ y_2 = v(x) y_1, \ y_2' = v' y_1 + v y_1', \ plug into DE to solve for v
Differential Equations.description: For second-order linear homogeneous DE, if one solution y_1 is known, find second by assuming y_2 = v y_1 and reducing order.

example.problem: \text{Given y_1 = e^x for y'' - 2y' + y = 0, find y_2 using reduction of order.}

Differential Equations.name: Method of Undetermined Coefficients
Differential Equations.formula: Assume\ y_p = A e^{rx} \text{ or polynomial, etc., plug in and solve for coefficients}
Differential Equations.description: For non-homogeneous linear DE with constant coefficients, guess form of particular solution based on right-hand side.

Differential Equations.name: Method of Variation of Parameters
Differential Equations.description: For non-homogeneous linear DE, assume particular solution as linear combination of homogeneous solutions with variable parameters, solve system for u_1', u_2'.

example.problem: \text{Find y_p for y'' + y = \sec x, \ y_1 = \cos x, y_2 = \sin x.
example.solution:
\begin{aligned}
u_1' \cos x + u_2' \sin x &= 0 \\
-\nu_1' \sin x + u_2' \cos x &= \sec x \\
W = \cos^2 x + \sin^2 x = 1 \\
u_1' &= -\sin x \sec x = -\tan x \\
\nu_1 &= \ln |\cos x| \\
u_2' &= \sec x \cos x = 1 \\
\nu_2 &= x \\
y_p &= \ln |\cos x| \cos x + x \sin x \\
\boxed{y_p = \cos x \ln |\cos x| + x \sin x}
\end{aligned}

Differential Equations.name: D Operator
Differential Equations.formula: D = \frac{d}{dx}, \ D^n y = y^{(n)}, \ (D^2 + a D + b) y = 0
Differential Equations.description: Symbolic method using D for derivatives to solve linear DE with constant coefficients via factoring or auxiliary equation.

Differential Equations.name: Laplace Transform
Differential Equations.formula: \mathcal{L}\{f(t)\} = F(s) = \int_0^\infty e^{-st} f(t) \, dt
Differential Equations.description: Transforms DE from time domain to s-domain for easier solving, especially with initial conditions.

Differential Equations.name: Inverse Laplace Transform
Differential Equations.formula: f(t) = \mathcal{L}^{-1}\{F(s)\} = \frac{1}{2\pi i} \int_{\gamma - i\infty}^{\gamma + i\infty} e^{st} F(s) \, ds
Differential Equations.description: Recovers the time-domain function from the s-domain transform using tables or partial fractions.

Differential Equations.name: Laplace Transform of Derivative
Differential Equations.formula: \mathcal{L}\{y'\} = s Y(s) - y(0), \ \mathcal{L}\{y''\} = s^2 Y(s) - s y(0) - y'(0)
Differential Equations.description: Transforms derivatives into algebraic terms in s-domain, incorporating initial conditions.
